And while not every formula we test is a winner, we're constantly unearthing new favorites. Here, we've rounded up our latest hair, skin, fragrance, wellness and makeup discoveries — whether fresh-to-market drops or merely recent additions to our personal routines.April has left team Fashionista dreaming about some much-needed R&R. While a full spa day is definitely in the cards, we're also finding our own pockets of peace by leveling up our beauty routines with restorative hair-care and rejuvenating skin-care finds.Mirroring the flowers (finally) blossoming outside, we reached for floral and fruity fragrances this month, including a shimmering, guava-scented hair and body mist; a new rose-and-pomegranate launch from the Boy Smells rebrand; and a perfume that's an airy blend of mineral salt and apricot skin. We upgraded our hair-care routines with a root-refreshing dry shampoo, a shine-enhancing anti-frizz spray, a pre-wash deep conditioner treatment and a lightweight hair oil. On the skin-care front, our editors loved a brightening eye gel for refreshing tired eyes, a retinal-infused buttery body cream and multi-acid exfoliating pads for smoother, clearer-looking skin.See (and shop!) all of our must-have beauty discoveries that carried us through April, below.Scroll to ContinueRecommended ArticlesBriogeo Scalp Revival Rosemary Pre-Wash Scalp and Hair Oil, $32, available here: "My scalp (like my hair) tends to be on the drier side, which can lead to issues like flakes and shedding if left untreated. Since using this pre-wash regularly, though, it just feels perfectly balanced: not dry or tight, but not oily either, and I can definitely see some new growth in areas that are more prone to thinning." —Dhani Mau, Editor in ChiefIlia Eye Stylus Shadow Stick in Flax, $32, available here: "This is the ideal eye shadow for people who suck at doing eye shadow. The chunky swivel crayon features a flat, beveled tip to make it super simple to swipe on and then blend out with your finger (no brush needed!). I also use the corner edge of it to do a swipe of liner close to my lash line. The formula starts out creamy, but not waxy or overly pliable, and then sets after a few minutes. I love the shade Flax, a pale toffee color with a matte finish, for super subtle, no-makeup-makeup definition." —Steph Saltzman, Beauty & Style DirectorElf Cosmetics Glow Reviver Melting Lip Balm, $9, available here: "Some glossy balms end up delivering more shine than actual hydration, but this one leaves my lips feeling soft and moisturized without sacrificing a dewy sheen, thanks to an ultra-hydrating blend of shea butter, mango butter, cocoa butter and hyaluronic acid. Available in six deliciously scented shades, I'm partial to Blackberry Sorbet, a sheer black cherry hue that smells just like a basket of fresh berries." —Catie Pusateri, Contributing WriterBoy Smells Rosy Cheeks, $99, available here: "Don't come for me, PerfumeTok, but I'm really loving this Boy Smells rebrand. My favorite of the fragrances is Rosy Cheeks, a perfectly balanced fruity-floral scent with notes like white orchid, pomegranate, rose absolute and cassis. It evokes the feeling of having a picnic underneath Central Park's cherry blossoms — peaceful, sweet and spring-friendly." —Janelle Sessoms, Staff WriterAveda Botanical Repair Bond-Builder Pre-Shampoo Treatment, $56, available here: "I've been a longtime fan of Aveda's Botanical Repair line, so I was eager to try this new reparative treatment when it launched. I comb the conditioner-like formula through my dry hair and let it sit for 10 minutes before hopping in the shower. I do find that it's super effective at masking the appearance of split ends, with some even appearing sealed back together and seemingly preventing further splitting. With consistent use, the brand says this product can strengthen strands up to three fold, and just based on my experience so far, I'd say that's probably accurate." —Savannah Sitton, Market & Branded Content EditorKérastase Gloss Absolu All in One Anti-Frizz Spray, $48, available here: "Part of a new anti-frizz line called Gloss Absolu, this styling spray is one of the best I've ever used for blowing out my frizz-prone (3A/B) curls. In addition to protecting against heat up to 450° and (effectively) repelling humidity, it instantly detangles my hair (crucial for effective straightening) and adds real hydration and shine without weighing down my fine strands. The result is the shiny, smooth, bouncy and long-lasting blowout of my dreams. (The accompanying Glaze Drops oil is also excellent.)" —DhaniRetrouvé Skin Brilliance Priming Pads, $65, available here: "Family-owned skin-care brand Retrouvé makes such luxurious formulations, and these gentle exfoliating pads are my latest obsession. They're soaked with a blend of naturally derived AHAs (to slough dead skin cells and brighten) and panthenol (to soothe and moisturize) and I've found them gentle enough to use every morning. " —StephGlossier You Fleur Eau de Parfum, $78, available here: "I'm already a fan of Glossier You (specifically Rêve's warm, sweet-smelling notes), and the brand just added another winner to its lineup with Fleur, an airy floral scent. The springtime aroma blends a 'mineral salt accord' top note with osmanthus, ylang ylang, apricot skin and cashmeran heart notes for a burst of freshness grounded in a musky ambrox base note. Fleur is (aptly) much more floral than its sister scents, but its contemporary take on the classics instantly won it a coveted spot in my spring fragrance rotation." —CatieIles Formula Rinseless Root Refresh, $38, available here: "So many dry shampoos leave behind dusty residue that causes dullness, scalp dryness and a weighed-down effect. Not ideal for my dark, fine hair. That's why this 'rinseless refresh' is a game changer: The spritz-on liquid is perfect for sopping up oiliness, resetting volume, disappearing bedhead and cowlicks, adding shine and imparting a lovely fresh scent. You do need to spend a few seconds blow-drying it to activate all of that, but it's well worth that tiny bit of effort for how effectively it lets you fake a fresh shampoo." —StephJhenetics Float CBD Bath Soak, $25, available here: "This dreamy bath soak from Jhené Aiko's brand is so good, I finished the full bag this month. With a lavender scent, full-spectrum CBD (in the form of hemp extract and enhanced with safflower and soybean oils, which supposedly help the skin absorb the CBD), epsom and sea salts, it makes for a sensorial, all-around soothing experience. I love using it for tight muscles or to soak my tired feet — it feels like a special, luxurious ritual every time." —SavannahJan Marini Multi-Acid Exfoliating Pads, $100, available here: "These have made a real difference in curbing the never-ending cycle of stubborn breakouts I've been experiencing lately. Soaked in salicylic acid, azelaic acid and glycolic acid, they operate like a low-grade peel you might get from a facialist: After applying, you wait 10 minutes, during which there is some significant 'spiciness,' before rinsing it off. Thus, I don't have to worry as much about which products I use afterwards as I would with a serum that stays on the skin. Since using them a few times a week for the last couple of weeks, I've barely broken out at all and my skin feels smoother than ever." —DhaniTata Harper Brightening Eye Gel, $74, available here: "It's been a long month, filled with sleepless nights and fatigue-filled days. Usually, I'll reach for my trusty concealer to mask my exhaustion, but some days, I didn't have it in me to even do that. So I'm not exaggerating when I say this product really did its big one for me these past couple of weeks. Powered by hydrators (hyaluronic acid, oat ceramides), brighteners (upcycled avocado extract, kakadu plum) and depuffers (cucumber seed, green coffee bean complex), the lightweight, fast-absorbing gel instantly transformed my tired eyes to refreshed ones. With just a couple of swipes, my eye bags look noticeably less pronounced." —JanelleCeremonia Guava Perfume Hair & Body Mist, $38, available here: "Ceremonia's fan-favorite guava line has a delicious new addition: a shimmering hair and body mist that sensorially transports the wearer to a tropical getaway through notes of lemon zest, peach and guava. I'm typically hesitant to spritz any fragrance onto my hair, but this alcohol-free formula is packed with 98% natural ingredients like guava fruit/leaf extracts, agave leaf extract and alteromonas ferment extract that don't weigh down (or dry out) my strands. Plus, its ultra-fine shimmer leaves a dewy shine on skin that's amplified once you step into the sun for that golden-hour glow any time you want." —Catie Sugared + Bronzed Hocoba Body Oil, $28, available here: "It's oh-no-my-legs-are-ghostly-pale season, so I've been relying heavily on Sugared + Bronzed's quick and easy spray tans to de-Casper myself. To help maintain the glow for as long as possible — and enhance it with a moisturized-looking hint of a sheen — I've been turning to the brand's body oil. The blend of jojoba and coconut oils is simple and effective: It soaks in quickly, seals in moisture instantly and comes in a pump-top bottle for easy application (even with slippery hands). Plus, I love that it's scent-free." —StephSunnee Baeskin Baeside Sea Mousse, $28, available here: "This tanning mousse officially just replaced the one I'd been loyal to since college: It's simple to apply with the included mitt, and I find the 'bad tanner smell' (via DHA, which is responsible for the actual tanning process) to be significantly less offensive than in other formulas. The natural green undertone prevents that orange-y effect, and I love that, for less than $30, I can get at least four full-body applications out of one bottle." —SavannahLemme Tone Gummies, $30, available here: "These 'digestive support' gummies seem to give me a natural boost of energy which has helped support my exercise goals. I love the watermelon flavor, which also has a subtle kick of ginger to help wake me up on the way to the gym. Its ingredient list includes 'Chromax' (a supposedly bioavailable combination of the mineral chromium and picolinic acid), methylated B12 (to support mood and brain function), apple cider vinegar (to aid digestion and supports metabolic rate) and ginger for digestive benefits." —Savannah Soshe Waterline Eye Brightener, $24, available here: "Did I mention I was pretty tired this month? Another product I reached for consistently was this champagne-toned eye-brightening pencil, which I swiped on in lieu of my typical eyeliner. Drawing it along my waterline and the inner corners of my eyes helps me fake being energized, even when I most certainly am not." —Janelle Murad Retinal Resculpt Body Treatment, $79, available here: "I love any opportunity to slather my whole body in the most revered 'anti-aging' skin-care ingredient. (Hello, mid-30s.) This thick, buttery cream incorporates retinal, a gentler version of retinol, to promote elasticity, cell turnover and firmness. I went through my first tub at warp speed." —StephTwenty Twenty Beauty The Soothe Bundle, $94 $80, available here: "Allergy season is never fun, but these two products have significantly improved my allergy eye woes (dryness and itchiness). The hypochlorous acid mist is a gentle, natural antiseptic that soothes irritated eyes and skin, making it ideal for those with chronic dry eyes (shout out to my autoimmune girlies) and/or contact lens wearers, like myself. In the evening, I use the spray in tandem with the castor and argan oil-spiked brow and lash serum, which moisturizes and strengthens to promote growth (sans prostaglandins)." ​—SavannahHerbal Essences Lightweight Hair Oil, $10, available here: "I'll admit that I was a latecomer to the hair oil game, mainly because I was convinced my perpetually oily hair surely didn't need more oil, but I've since seen the light. This formula reinvigorates my waves with the help of aloe and camellia oil. I concentrate one pump of the lightweight oil on my ends, which has significantly reduced unwanted frizz and added a healthy shine to my strands without looking greasy. As a bonus, it also smells amazing thanks to its fruity floral scent." —CatiePeach & Lily Glass Skin Luminizing Stick, $39, available here: "I've never been into proper highlighters, and this balm-textured stick is decidedly not that. Instead of sparkle, it just imparts a subtle sheen, resulting in skin that looks naturally luminous and hydrated. I was honestly shocked when multiple people commented on how glowy my skin looked the first time I used it." —DhaniTribe Tokes CBN Tincture For Sleep, $50, available here: "In honor of 4/20 and as a suffering insomniac, I've been turning to this tincture for relief and made it a staple in my evening routine. The lemon-mint flavor is pleasantly refreshing (I like a few drops in my evening sparkling water, or under my tongue as instructed for a more immediate effect), and I notice a subtle calming effect that helps me unwind without feeling high or excessively drowsy. The tincture contains 1,200mg of CBN (known for its relaxing, sleep-supportive properties) and 600mg of CBD (associated with overall stress relief and inflammation reduction) per bottle, and it's made with organic ingredients, including MCT oil, which enhances absorption. It's also legal in all states." —SavannahIn case you missed last month's picks, you can find them here:Please note: Occasionally, we use affiliate links on our site. Each month, Fashionista editors try a *lot* of beauty products. And while not every formula we test is a winner, we're constantly unearthing new favorites. Here, we've rounded up our latest hair, skin, fragrance, wellness and makeup discoveries — whether fresh-to-market drops or merely recent additions to our personal routines.

April has left team Fashionista dreaming about some much-needed R&R. While a full spa day is definitely in the cards, we're also finding our own pockets of peace by leveling up our beauty routines with restorative hair-care and rejuvenating skin-care finds.

Mirroring the flowers (finally) blossoming outside, we reached for floral and fruity fragrances this month, including a shimmering, guava-scented hair and body mist; a new rose-and-pomegranate launch from the Boy Smells rebrand; and a perfume that's an airy blend of mineral salt and apricot skin. We upgraded our hair-care routines with a root-refreshing dry shampoo, a shine-enhancing anti-frizz spray, a pre-wash deep conditioner treatment and a lightweight hair oil. On the skin-care front, our editors loved a brightening eye gel for refreshing tired eyes, a retinal-infused buttery body cream and multi-acid exfoliating pads for smoother, clearer-looking skin.

See (and shop!) all of our must-have beauty discoveries that carried us through April, below.
